abstract.text: Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The iPadOS 16 SDK provides support to develop apps for iPad devices running iPadOS 16. The SDK comes bundled with Xcode 14.1 RC, available from
. For information on the compatibility requirements for Xcode 14.1, see
returns
on iPads that support Stage Manager. (88345287)
To improve security,
enforces parameter correctness on macOS 13 Ventura, iOS 16, iPadOS 16, watchOS 9, and tvOS 16. Passing an incorrect
is no longer supported, and will result in images failing to load. (94855401)
Customers using iOS 16 can now back up their device over an LTE cellular connection, as well as a 5G or Wifi connection. (95276719)
Devices running beta 4 or later aren’t backwards compatible with devices running earlier beta versions. (95233878)
The search field for the emoji Lock Screen editor is missing. (88603664)
Many additional Bluetooth and USB game controllers are supported by the Game Controller framework on macOS 13, iOS 16, and tvOS 16 and later. (82409809)
HealthKit workout APIs now support multisport workouts with activities of swimming, cycling, and running. (82588168)
New data types for running workout metrics like running power, ground contact time, vertical oscillation, running speed, and stride length. (82974514)
A new data type is available to track AFib History. (95315701)
The
framework has a new Vision Prescription data type that allows developers and users to store prescription information received from eye care professionals. This feature includes a new set of

subclasses that allow developers to encapsulate prescriptions for glasses and contact lenses. Users of iPhone can directly store their prescription information from the Health app as well. Because most regions require the actual prescription document to purchase glasses and contacts, this feature also allows the storage of attachment files in
. Due to the potential privacy concerns around sharing unintended additional details from the prescription, the
framework has a new authorization API to allow users to authorize prescriptions on a per-sample basis. See header documentation in
and watch the WWDC HealthKit session for more information. (82940646)
You might receive an alert to turn on Wi-Fi when pairing a Matter accessory. (98460235)
Workaround:
Ensure your device is connected to your Wi-Fi network.
Adjusting the color or color temperature might result in an unexpected color set on a Matter accessory. (98578966)
Accessory details might not open if a Matter accessory is unreachable. (99232316)
The device that initiates the pairing needs to use the same iCloud account as the home hub. Only the owner of a home, not an invited user, can pair Matter accessories. (76012945)
Moving a Remind Me message to another mailbox doesn’t remove the Remind Me banner. (93671992)
Don’t use
, and
. Use their functional equivalents
, and
, instead. Additionally,
is now deprecated. (93449747)
The system memory allocator
operation zeroes out all deallocated blocks in iPadOS 16 beta or later. Invalid accesses to free memory might result in new crashes or corruption, including:
Read-after-free bugs that previously observed the old contents of a block may now observe zeroes instead
Write-after-free bugs may now cause subsequent calls to
to return non-zero memory
To debug these issues, use Address Sanitizer and Guard Malloc (see
Allows developers to classify incoming SMS from unknown numbers into 12 new sub-categories within
and
categories for improved organization. (95276296)

For Indian users, Messages now supports event extraction from SMS. These event and appointment messages are presented as Siri suggestions and also are presented to users in Messages thread and in Calendar Inbox. (95276513)
For selected US Carriers, Messages extends the “Report Junk” feature to enable users to report SMS/MMS junk to Carriers. The option is visible inside Messages from Unknown Senders. (95276623)
Messages now supports the ability for customers with a dual SIM iPhone to filter their messages based on their SIMs. (95276784)

When using the new Metal mesh shaders feature, render pipeline state objects (PSOs) created with a mesh shader stage but without a object shader stage can fail to compile or fail to work correctly on some devices. (89836551)
Workaround:
When creating render PSOs with a mesh shader stage, also include a (potentially trivial pass-through) object shader stage.
The
is deprecated. Use
instead, which functions as a replacement. (92862429)
effect outputs aren’t designed to be consumed by the CPU. Outputting to a texture that is read only by the CPU might result in synchronization issues. (91515075)
Workaround:
If a CPU reading of the
output is desired, instead of encoding the
effect as the last item in a command buffer, encode a dummy blit that consumes the
output texture (a 1-pixel region blit is fine) in the command buffer. After the command buffer with the dummy blit is finished, reading of the
effect output texture with CPU synchronizes correctly.
Added
support for client-certificate based authentication. (24523955)
Added
support for Private Access Tokens. (82937526)
FTP is deprecated for
and related APIs. Please adopt modern secure networking protocols such as HTTPS. (92623659)
The
framework is now available in iPadOS 16, enabling 3D parametric model creation of an interior room. The framework uses a device’s sensors, trained machine learning models, and

rendering capabilities to capture the physical surroundings of an interior room. APIs are available for end-to-end scanning experience, real-time data structures for custom UI creation, and both USD and USDZ generation of 3D room models. (84170837)
All
APIs are now annotated for sendability and main actor isolation. (84157048)
A property
is included in

. It represents the date that marks the start of the most recent period of continuous subscription. A period is considered a continuous subscription if there is no more than a 60-day gap between any two subscribed periods. (86599570)
has new properties for localizing prices and subscription periods. For iOS 15, iPadOS 15, macOS 12, tvOS 15, and watchOS 8 or later use
to format numbers derived from
. Use
to format durations of time relating to a subscription period. On iOS 16, iPadOS 16, macOS 13, tvOS 16, and watchOS 9 or later use
to format single units of a subscription period. (93780442)
A property environment is included in
and
. It represents the server environment in which the
and
occurred, respectively. (85988753)
allows developers to cryptographically verify that the app was purchased on the App Store. (86739279)
The
property is included in

. It represents the date that marks the start of the most recent period of continuous subscription. A period is considered a continuous subscription if there’s no more than a 60-day gap between any two subscribed periods. (86599570)
The
property is included in
. Use this property to format price values deriving from the product’s decimal price. (81480683)
Present the offer code redemption sheet with the
view modifier in your SwiftUI apps. (85321941)
The StoreKit Messages API allows you to control when App Store messages are displayed in your app. (85321880)
Read the
environment value to get an instance of a
. Then, call this instance to request to display a review prompt from your SwiftUI apps. (86739003)
Fixed an issue where restoring transactions wouldn’t prompt for authentication or restore any transactions if there was no App Store account signed in. (99506258)
Fixed an issue where purchasing or restoring in-app transactions with hosted content would block new purchases or restores from processing. (100117681)

Deprecated the SKDownload API and removed the option to upload nonconsumable in-app purchase assets for Apple to host. In addition, support for managing these assets in App Store Connect is no longer available as of April 2022. (89764253)
You can now place a
in an
by using
modifiers that accept a
For
, or other views that have a
, the
content now automatically arranges and styles multiple views as hierarchical elements, such as
and
. If the
views are intended to be arranged horizontally rather than hierarchically, wrap the views within an
A
supports multiline text. Use a
axis on a text field to allow rendering of multiple lines in contexts like forms, where text is expected to be short to medium length. For long-form text editing, continue to use a
Navigation bars have new default behaviors. A navigation bar defaults to an inline title display mode, if no title is provided. If a title is provided, the default remains large. Use the
modifier to change this. By default, a navigation bar only renders if it has content to display. If a navigation bar has no title, toolbar items, or search content, it’s automatically hidden. Use the
or the new
modifier to explicitly show an empty navigation bar. (84996257)
A
supports Section footers. (78462739)
When the toolbar modifier is applied at multiple levels of a hierarchy, items from a child are appended to those from the parent that have the same placement. (65619097)
When using
, windows created with SwiftUI set their resizable and fullscreen flags based on the size of their contents. (65791490)
separator insets can now be customized using
and
alignment guides. (74192080)
The implementation of
no longer uses
SwiftUI now enforces at runtime that view and view controller representables are value types. (82982458)
Symbol images now use an automatically determined symbol-rendering mode by default. To have a symbol image always use monochrome rendering, use the
modifier. (85524479)
A Picker with a menu style in a
displays its
by default. To hide the
, use the
modifier. (88228016)
Pickers in
default to the menu style. (89186618)
Changes to
and
views now animate by default. Use
to disable this behavior. (89558882)
Lists and forms automatically dismiss the software keyboard, if present, when a scroll gesture begins. Use
to restore the old behavior. (89588639)
Added
, which permits customization of background colors for scrollable views like
Added
and
modifiers to be used in conjunction with the new
to allow an
to be vended by the focused view or scene. (83637876)
Custom types conforming to
now support dynamic properties like
Providing actions to a
modifier has been deprecated. Use the
modifier or
type in a toolbar modifier instead. (93658035)
Lists and tables might not clear their selection when exiting Edit Mode. (94093589)
iOS apps can now request rotation using
and providing a
object containing the desired orientations. (95229615)
has been deprecated is no longer supported.
has been deprecated and replaced with
Workaround:
Apps relying on
should reflect their preferences using the view controllers
. If the supported orientations change, use `-[UIViewController setNeedsUpdateOfSupportedInterface
American Express cards might need to be removed and re-added to Wallet after updating to iPadOS 16 beta 6 or later. (97990752)

abstract.text: Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the user’s privacy and control.
A HealthKit sample represents a piece of data associated with a start and end time.
Values that control the map’s elevation style.
The characteristics of the map view, including the map type and features the map displays.
Values that control how the framework emphasizes map features.
Simulate and render 3D content for use in your augmented reality apps.
Create a 3D model of a room by interactively guiding people to scan their physical environment using a device’s camera.
Support In-App Purchases and interactions with the App Store.
Information that represents the customer’s purchase of the app, cryptographically signed by the App Store.
Information about a product that you configure in App Store Connect.
The renewal information for an auto-renewable subscription.
An instance that tells StoreKit to request an App Store rating or review, if appropriate.
The locale used to format the price of the product.
Information that represents the customer’s purchase of a product in your app.
A representation of an alert presentation.
The vertical dimension.
A view that arranges its subviews in a horizontal line.
The leading edge.
The trailing edge.
A standard label for user interface items, consisting of an icon with a title.
A container that presents rows of data arranged in a single column, optionally providing the ability to select one or more members.
A container view that you can use to add hierarchy within certain views.
A symbol rendering mode.
A view that can display and edit long-form text.
A control that displays an editable text interface.
Hides the navigation bar for this view.
Configures the title display mode for this view.
Presents a sheet that enables users to redeem subscription offer codes that you configure in App Store Connect.
A custom parameter attribute that constructs views from closures.
A view that presents data using rows in a single column.
